clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of the Response to Neoadjuvant Radiation Chemotherapy Through Texture Analysis Derived From Medical Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of the Response to Neoadjuvant Radiation Chemotherapy Through Texture Analysis Derived From Magnetic Resonance Imaging, Contrast Injection Computed Tomography and Positron Emission Tomography at 18-FDG in Locally Advanced Rectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
In patient with complete pathological response, surgery could be omitted without compromising progression-free or overall survivl. A powerful prediction model is needed to guide management of this population.
Radiomics features provide complementary information about tumor heterogenity.
The aim of the investigators is to develop a model combining clinical and radiomic criteria able to predict complete pathological response.

primary_outcome.measure: Prediction of the complete response (pCR) to neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: TO = Immediately after biopsy and extension evaluation.
primary_outcome.description: defined as the absence of tumor residue on the surgical specimen, ypT0N0

clinical_study.condition: Develop a Predictive Model of the Complete Pathological Response Using Texture Analysis

arm_group.description: patients from which we will develop the prediction model
patients on whom we will test the prediction model

study_pop.textblock: Patient with locally advanced rectal cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- locally advanced rectal cancer
- patients who received concomitant radio-chemotherapy followed by surgery
- pre-therapeutic MRI and CT-scan dicom available
Exclusion Criteria:
- age under 18 yo
- lack of MRI or CT-scan
